meanings.definition: A wealthy landowner or farmer in Latin America.
meanings.sent1: The hacendados owned vast lands and employed many workers.
meanings.sent2: The hacendados in the region were known for their large estates.
meanings.sent3: The hacendados decided to have a friendly competition on who could grow the tallest corn.
meanings.sent4: The influence of the hacendados in the community was as strong as the roots of an ancient tree.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hacendados overseeing their fields was etched in the minds of the villagers.

meanings.sent1: Many hacendados gathered for the annual farming conference.
meanings.sent2: The hacendados' opinions varied on the best irrigation methods.
meanings.sent3: During the festival, the hacendados wore colorful hats to stand out.
meanings.sent4: The market was bustling with activity as the hacendados negotiated prices.
meanings.sent5: The hacendados' presence at the market was like a flock of colorful birds.
